Sentence: Louis and Blanche are married when Pandolf, an ambassador from the pope, arrives
Pandolf excommunicates John and charges Louis with the duty of overthrowing John

Meanwhile Pandolf tries to encourage the French to fight, suggesting to Louis that he (Louis) now can lay the same claim to the throne of England as Arthur, because he (Arthur) has married into a branch of the English royal family
Pandolf arrives with news that John has reconciled with Rome and tries to dissuade Louis from attacking, but Louis says he (John) won't be ordered around by anyone
The Bastard prepares to attack Louis, but the nobles report that Pandolf had just brought them a peace treaty from Louis
